journey.title: My Journey
journey.body: I'm a full-stack software engineer holding an Engineering degree in Computer Science from ESPRIT. I enjoy building reliable products that combine clean architecture, strong backend foundations, and modern user interfaces.

do.title: What I Do
do.body: I develop end-to-end web solutions using React and Angular on the frontend, and backend stacks like Node.js, PHP (including Joomla), and Django. I'm comfortable designing REST application programming interfaces (REST APIs), integrating third-party services, and delivering features from idea to production.

approach.title: My Approach
approach.body: I focus on maintainable code, clear collaboration, and consistent delivery. I care about performance, testing, and practical automation-like Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) to ship fast without sacrificing quality.

beyond.title: Beyond Code
beyond.body: I value teamwork and leadership. At university, I served as President of ChessSpirit Club, organizing activities and building a supportive community-skills I bring into engineering teams and agile projects.

skills.title: Technical Skills
skills.subtitle: A comprehensive overview of the technologies and tools I work with to build modern web applications.

resume.role: IT Officer - Full-Stack Developer (React/PHP) & Systems Support
resume.profile: Software Engineer with hands-on experience modernizing Joomla/CiviCRM platforms and building scalable React and TypeScript applications. Delivered PHP and MySQL-backed REST APIs, integrated authentication and data flows (CORS, tokens), and built responsive UIs with Vite and Tailwind CSS. Comfortable with Linux deployments (Apache/Nginx, php-fpm), CI/CD pipelines, and day-to-day systems support in Agile teams.

w1.title: CRM Modernization (Joomla + CiviCRM) — Bureau International des Expositions (BIE), Paris
details: Upgraded legacy Joomla 3 to Joomla 5 and migrated CiviCRM 4.7 to CiviCRM 6
Refactored custom components, updated deprecated APIs, and ensured compatibility with PHP 8.2 and the new Joomla architecture
Implemented backend REST endpoints in Joomla and integrated them with a React + Vite frontend
Optimized data flows and improved delegate/member-state workflows, performance, and maintainability

w2.title: E-commerce Marketplace — FIDNESS
details: Developed core business modules: product catalog, shopping cart, coupons, orders, and secure OTP email authentication workflows
Built Golang microservices (authentication, product management, payment verification) with clean, modular architecture
Integrated external banking APIs for transaction validation and real-time callbacks

w3.title: Enterprise Software Delivery — WEVIOO, Tunis
details: Implemented RESTful backend services using C#/.NET
Improved code quality through reviews and documentation

w4.title: Full-Stack Internship — ALFA Computers, Mahdia
details: Built frontend modules in React integrated with REST APIs
Supported backend development using Node.js + MongoDB
Assisted with deployment tasks and production rollout support

e1.title: Engineering Degree in Computer Science
details: Full-stack software engineering and modern web architectures
Strong emphasis on React, Angular, Node.js, Spring Boot, clean architecture, DevOps, and CI/CD pipelines

e2.title: Preparatory Cycle for Engineering Studies
details: Advanced mathematics, physics, algorithms, and problem-solving
Preparation for national engineering entrance examinations

e3.title: Baccalaureate in Mathematics
details: National diploma with a focus on advanced mathematics and scientific reasoning

projects.title: Featured Projects
projects.subtitle: Here are some of my recent projects showcasing my skills in full-stack development and modern web technologies.

p1.title: BIE CRM Modernization (Joomla 5 + CiviCRM 6 + React)
p1.description: Modernized an internal CRM by upgrading Joomla 3 to Joomla 5 and migrating CiviCRM 4.7 to CiviCRM 6. Built new REST endpoints and integrated a React + Vite frontend with Tailwind CSS, improving workflows and maintainability.

p2.title: FIDNESS — E-commerce Marketplace + Golang Microservices
p2.description: Contributed to an online marketplace storefront and core business modules (catalog, cart, coupons, orders, OTP authentication). Built Golang microservices and integrated external banking APIs for transaction validation and real-time callbacks.

p3.title: WEVIOO — .NET REST Services + Angular Components
p3.description: Implemented RESTful backend services using C#/.NET and built reusable Angular components. Contributed to code quality improvements through reviews and documentation.

p4.title: ALFA Computers — React Frontend + Node.js & MongoDB
p4.description: Built frontend modules in React.js integrated with REST APIs and supported backend development using Node.js and MongoDB. Assisted with deployment tasks and production rollout support.

p5.title: Music Streaming Platform
p5.description: Music streaming web application with playlist management, user sessions, and secure OAuth2/JWT authentication. Responsive UI built with Tailwind CSS.

p6.title: DevOps Foyer — CI/CD Pipeline
p6.description: Designed and deployed a CI/CD pipeline with automated build and testing, SonarQube analysis, Docker image generation, and Jenkins orchestration. Monitoring with Grafana and artifact storage on Nexus.

p7.title: EpicJourneys — Travel Manager
p7.description: Java MVC application with a MySQL backend for managing events, itineraries, reservations, and user interactions.

p8.title: Co & Co — Carpooling and Colocation Platform
p8.description: Full-stack platform combining a Spring Boot backend with an Angular frontend, offering listings, user profiles, and search features for students.

volunteering.title: Activities
volunteering.subtitle: Leadership and organizational experience through student club activities, focused on coordination, mentoring, and community engagement.

1.description: Organized internal and inter-school chess tournaments, managed event logistics including registrations, match schedules, and coordination with participants. Led regular training sessions focused on tactical skills, opening strategies, and competitive play. Mentored club members, supported beginner and intermediate players, and promoted strategic thinking, discipline, and teamwork.

hobbies.title: Hobbies & Interests
hobbies.subtitle: When I'm not coding or leading community initiatives, here's what I enjoy doing.

1.name: Coding
1.description: Building side projects and exploring new technologies

2.name: Reading
2.description: Tech blogs, documentation, and software architecture books

4.name: Movies
4.description: Enjoying films and exploring different storytelling styles

6.name: Podcasts
6.description: Tech talks, business insights, and personal development

contact.title: Get In Touch
contact.subtitle: Have a question or want to work together? Feel free to reach out!

communityDetails.title: Activities
communityDetails.subtitle: President at ChessSpirit Club (ESPRIT). I organized tournaments and training sessions to help members improve their skills and stay engaged through consistent practice and competition.
communityDetails.featuredDescription: Organized chess tournaments and structured training sessions. Focused on improving performance, building consistency, and keeping a friendly competitive spirit inside the club.

1.title: Tournaments Organization
1.description: Prepared tournaments from start to finish: registrations, pairings, scheduling, and results.

2.title: Training Sessions
2.description: Led structured sessions around tactics, opening principles, and endgame fundamentals.

3.title: Team & Club Engagement
3.description: Encouraged participation and a positive learning environment for different skill levels.

1.description: Organized chess tournaments and training sessions to improve members’ competitive level and engagement.
responsibilities: Planned and ran tournaments (format, pairings, rounds, results)
Mentored beginners and supported intermediate players
Coordinated with club members to ensure smooth event execution
